exerciseTemplate.name: Exercise Name (e.g., 'Barbell Bench Press')
exerciseTemplate.muscleGroup: chest | back | shoulders | arms | legs | core
equipment: bodyweight | dumbbell | barbell | kettlebells | cables | machines | resistance bands | cardio machines | none
exerciseTemplate.movementType: push | pull | squat | hinge | lunge | rotation | anti-rotation | carry | cardio | isometric
goals: muscle building | strength training | fat loss conditioning | mobility/stretching | warm-up activation | rehabilitation
exerciseTemplate.description: A detailed description of the exercise, what it targets, and why it's effective.
instructions: Continue with more steps as needed
exerciseTemplate.videoUrl: YouTube URL (full URL, embed URL, or youtu.be short URL)

exampleExercise.name: Barbell Bench Press
exampleExercise.description: The barbell bench press is a compound exercise that primarily targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's one of the most effective exercises for building upper body strength and muscle mass.
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly over your chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar to your chest with control, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Press the bar back up explosively until your arms are fully extended.
Keep your core tight and maintain a slight arch in your back throughout the movement.
cues: Retract your shoulder blades before unracking.
Keep your wrists straight and grip tight.
Drive through your feet for stability.
Squeeze your chest at the top of the movement.
commonMistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest
Flaring elbows too wide (should be 45 degrees)
variations: Dumbbell Bench Press (greater range of motion)
safetyTips: Always use a spotter when lifting heavy weights
Use safety bars or spotters in a power rack
Start with lighter weights to perfect form
Warm up thoroughly before heavy sets
suggestedWarmups: Light bench press (50% of working weight)

fieldDescriptions.name: Required. Full name of the exercise.
fieldDescriptions.slug: Required. URL-friendly version of name (auto-generated if not provided). Lowercase, hyphens instead of spaces.
fieldDescriptions.muscleGroup: Required. Main muscle group: chest, back, shoulders, arms, legs, or core.
fieldDescriptions.subMuscles: Required. Array of specific muscles targeted. Must match the enum values for the selected muscleGroup.
fieldDescriptions.equipment: Required. Array of equipment needed. Can include multiple items.
fieldDescriptions.difficulty: Required. Skill level: beginner, intermediate, or advanced.
fieldDescriptions.goals: Required. Array of training goals this exercise helps achieve.
fieldDescriptions.exerciseType: Optional. compound or isolation. Defaults to compound.
fieldDescriptions.description: Required. 2-3 sentences describing the exercise and its benefits.
fieldDescriptions.instructions: Required. Array of step-by-step instructions (minimum 4-6 steps).
fieldDescriptions.cues: Optional. Array of mind-muscle connection cues (3-5 items recommended).
fieldDescriptions.setsReps: Optional. Object with strength, hypertrophy, and endurance recommendations. Defaults provided if omitted.
fieldDescriptions.videoUrl: Optional. YouTube URL (any format) or direct video URL.
fieldDescriptions.imageUrl: Optional. URL to exercise demonstration image.
fieldDescriptions.commonMistakes: Optional. Array of common form mistakes to avoid (3-5 items recommended).
fieldDescriptions.variations: Optional. Array of exercise variations (easier/harder versions).
fieldDescriptions.alternativeNames: Optional. Array of alternative names for the exercise.
fieldDescriptions.safetyTips: Optional. Array of safety considerations (3-5 items recommended).
fieldDescriptions.suggestedWarmups: Optional. Array of recommended warm-up exercises.
